title: Text&Image
description: Have text and image in the same row. You can also declare the span of text thus changing the size of image, and changing the position of text.

children.value: This is the display format for the
constructor, designed to showcase what are its capabilities.

These are the properties and attributes associated to the

constructor gives you an option to hold both image and text in one row. Text size, position and alignement are fully adjustable. Below is a detailed description of the properties and attributes used in the
property in the component is a configuration object that allows customization of various styling aspects of the component. Each attribute within the
property targets a specific part of the component display, providing detailed control over its appearance and layout. Below is a detailed description of each attribute within the
Defines the overall styling for the container that holds all the elements of the component.
Styles applied to the image element, including properties like size and border radius.
Styles applied to the title text, such as font size and color.
Styles applied to the subtitle text, such as font size and color.
Styles applied to the text content, such as font size and color.
Defines position of text in regard of image.
Defines amount of space that will text occupy.
Styles for the container background depending on the status value.
The source URL of the image to be displayed.
Alternative text for the image, used for accessibility and in case the image fails to load.
The title text to be displayed.
The subtitle text to be displayed, if any.
The main text content to be displayed.
Intented to be used as a help to content writter. Doesn`t render on website.

This is the content inside of the
. It list properties where styles can be applied:
"bg-gray-50 dark:bg-inherit border-2 border-neutral-300 dark:border-neutral-500 rounded-2xl shadow-2xl p-5"
These represent the class values utilized in the
constructor. These values are customizable and can be strengthened or overridden through the

: This defines the overall styling for the container holding the elements. The value "px-8 border dark:border-gray-700 rounded-2xl" includes horizontal padding of 8 units (px-8), a border (border) with a gray color in dark mode (dark:border-gray-700), and rounded corners (rounded-2xl).
: This defines the styling for the title text. The value "font-bold text-2xl" includes a bold font weight (font-bold) and a double extra-large font size (text-2xl).

: This specifies the styling for the subtitle text. The value "font-semibold text-xl -mt-6" includes a semi-bold font weight (font-semibold), an extra-large font size (text-xl), and a negative top margin of 6 units (-mt-6).
: This defines the styling for general text. As it is empty, it implies no specific styles have been set.
: This specifies styles for an image. The value "mx-auto rounded-xl" includes horizontal centering (mx-auto) and rounded corners (rounded-xl).
: Imported from a separate module (status). It contains additional styles or functionality related to status.
: This object is intended to hold any default Tailwind CSS values that might be used as fallback or initial styles.
These style properties ensure that the
component is visually appealing and flexible, allowing for a wide range of customization to meet specific design requirements.

html .default .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}

title: Video
description: Embed video either from YouTube or from your local

children.value: constructor is displayed, enabling the embedding of videos with custom styles.
This is how it is constructed:
These are the properties and attributes associated with the
constructor creates a display format for embedding a video with customizable styles. Below is a detailed description of the properties and attributes used in the
constructor is a configuration object that allows for the customization of various styling aspects of the video component. Below is a detailed description of each attribute within the
Defines the overall styling for the container that holds the video.
The source URL of the video to be embedded. This property is mandatory.
Intented to be used as a help to content writter. Doesn`t render on website.
This is an example with customized

props.code:
::ShVideo
---
ui:
    wrapper: "shadow-2xl mx-auto max-w-screen-lg" # custom styles for the wrapper
src: "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8A5AMiskxvQ"
---
::

children.value: These style properties can be modified via
These represent the class values utilized in the
constructor. These values are customizable and can be strengthened or overridden through the
: This defines the overall styling for the video container. The value "mx-5 ring-4" indicates a horizontal margin of 5 units (mx-5) and a ring (border) of 4 units.
: This object is intended to hold any default Tailwind CSS values that might be used as fallback or initial styles.
These style properties ensure that the
component is visually appealing and flexible, allowing for a wide range of customization to meet specific design requirements.

html .default .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}
